newsitem.title: UK: Attention disorder inherited, study finds.
newsitem.headline: Attention disorder inherited, study finds.

text.p: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), which makes children fidgety and hard to manage, may be inherited, Australian researchers say.
Florence Levy and colleagues at the University of New South Wales found the condition was shared by between 75 and 91 percent of 2,000 identical twins, New Scientist magazine reported on Thursday.
They said their findings took account of other factors, such as a shared environment.
ADHD affects between four and six percent of school-age children. Several genes have been linked with the disorder, which is often treated with drugs.
